Comment: I didn't say he would intervene in American politics as pope. I'm saying the fact that he already *has* gotten vocally involved in American politics by repeatedly condemning the Trump administration on Twitter this year, as recently as last month, was absolutely taken into account by the cardinals. He's expected to continue Pope Francis' tradition of emphasizing the Church's role in social justice, which is naturally at odds with the Trump administration. And the cardinals surely recognize that the Church needs leadership that considers its role in opposing the rise of fascism globally, especially when it's coming from a nation as powerful as America. That's not just about "American politics." It's about how what America does affects the whole world.
